result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Oscar Danielson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall pay $10 per month towards financial obligations until paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Jeremy Oscar Danielson in court with attorney Courtney J Latzig.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 10:46 a.m.  Cites appearances.  DEJ filed.  Attorney Latzig states agreement is acceptible.  Def understands "contract".  PLQ and ARIPR completed.  Pleads NC to all counts per atty.  Def agrees, freely pleads, admits signing PLQ.  Atty satisfied freely pleads, court accepts, withholds judgment per DEJ.  Approves and signs DEJ.  DEJ is only on 16CF44, Count #1.  Court only imposes one set of costs on all cases.  Def shall pay $10 per month towards financial obligations.  Adj. 10:54 a.m.  klr
DEJ Agreement

MINUTES FROM 16CF44 AFFECTING BOND:  Jeremy Danielson in court, in custody.  Frederick j Schellgell appears on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.  Cites appearances.  Possible charges are misd. theft, entry to dwelling, felony bail jumping.  Public def info given.  $500 cash/no contact with N. family.  Right to counsel explained by Judge.  Court questions def re ability to raise money.  Court sets $500 cash bond with condition of no contact with N. family.  To be set once counsel is available.  This is an omnibus bond.  Any other conditions on this case as well.  klr
This is an omnibus bond.  Defendant is to stay out of Dan R's place of business (victim in 16CM24) and to have no contact with N. family in pending case.
Pre-trial conference on October 3, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Courtney J Latzig in court.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Although defendant not present in courtroom, def is in building.  Request made to adjourn to 10/3/16.  Court grants adjournment.  klr
